messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Book suggestions for a Control Freak?
messages.msgSnippet: ... If by control, you mean trying to control your children, try _Everyday Blessings_ by Jon and Myla Kabat-Zinn. Marjorie
messages.messageBody:
>
> << Any specific suggestions for books for a contol freak or how to trust
> more ? >>
>
If by control, you mean trying to control your children, try _Everyday
Blessings_ by Jon and Myla Kabat-Zinn.

Marjorie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Book suggestions for a Control Freak?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/8/03 3:23:38 PM, Puddinghead1@cs.com writes:  I would
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/8/03 3:23:38 PM, Puddinghead1@... writes:

<< Any specific suggestions for books for a contol freak or how to trust
more ? >>

I would just recommend any Buddhist stuff, the easy kind of zen-thing-a-day
books, or go to a big bookstore and look at the daily affirmations and see if
any seem to fit your particulars.

And take that controlling energy and CONTROL something! Get your yard really
clean and weeded. Groom the heck out of your dog. Clean and repaper your
kitchen cabinets. Make lists. Go through clothes. Make a quilt. A really
complicated quilt.

Sandra
